alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Schenectady; Schoharie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 04 at 3:21PM EDT until August 04 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Schenectady County in east central New York... Northern Schoharie County in east central New York... Southwestern Montgomery County in eastern New York... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 321 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Cherry Valley, or 10 miles southwest of Canajoharie, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Duanesburg, Middleburgh, Schoharie, Richmondville, Sharon Springs, Delanson, Ames, Central Bridge, Carlisle, Sharon, Seward, Esperance, Duane, Zeh Corners, Beekman Corners, West Richmondville, Rockwell Corners, Huntersland and Warnerville. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
